summary: Lake Kariba is the biggest man-made lake and reservoir globally, located along the border of Zambia and Zimbabwe. It was created between 1958 and 1963 when the Kariba Dam was built, flooding the Kariba Gorge on the Zambezi River. The lake has several towns nearby, like Kariba in Zimbabwe, and Siavonga in Zambia, which were established to accommodate workers and people displaced by the dam's construction.
title: Lake Kariba
